title: Tolkien and the Critics - Essays on J R R Tolkien's The Lord of
description:
Tolkien and the Critics

Essays on J R R Tolkien's The Lord of the Rings

Edited by Neil D. Isaacs, Rose A. Zimbardo


CONTENTS

1. On the Possibilities of Writing Tolkien Criticism - Neil D. Isaacs
2. The Dethronement of Power - C. S. Lewis
3. The Lord of the Hobbits - Edmund Fuller
4. The Quest Hero - W. H. Auden
5. The Appeal of The Lord of the Rings - Hugh T. Keenan
6. Power and Meaning in The Lord of the Rings - Patricia Meyer Spacks
7. Moral Vision in The Lord of the Rings - Rose A. Zimbardo
8. Men, Halflings, and Hero Worship - Marion Zimmer Bradley
9. Tolkien and the Fairy Story - Robert J. Reilly
10. Tolkien: The Monsters and the Critters - Thomas J. Gasque
11. Old English in Rohan - John Tinkler
12. Poetry of Fantasy: Verse in The Lord of the Rings - Mary Quella Kelly
13. The Shire, Mordor, and Minas Tirith - Charles Moorman
14. The Lord of the Rings as Literature - Burton Raffel
15. Tolkien and Frodo Baggins - Roger Sale


Enjoy and please SEED!!!
